title: 2 Easy Ways to Update Apps on Your Amazon Fire TV Stick

steps.title: Select the Apps icon.
steps.content: Select the Apps icon. This will be on the homepage, to the left of the cog icon. Use this method to update apps manually. Otherwise, you can enable automatic updates . If you need to update apps you downloaded from outside the Appstore, such as Kodi or Cinema HD , you'll need to follow similar steps used to download it.

steps.title: Highlight the app you want to update.
steps.content: Highlight the app you want to update. Don't click the app; just highlight it. You should see the app appear bigger than the rest.

steps.title: On your remote, press ☰.
steps.content: On your remote, press ☰ . This will open the app's options.

steps.title: Select More Info.
steps.content: Select More Info . This is one of the middle options. The app's page will open.

steps.title: Select Update if available.
steps.content: Select Update if available. When there's an available update, you'll see this underneath the app's title. If there's no update available, you'll just see Open . You can also clear the cache for apps if you find your Fire Stick freezing often.

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . This is the cog icon on your homepage. When this is enabled, apps should update automatically when there's an available update. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select Applications.
steps.content: Select Applications . You can find this tile towards the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Select Appstore.
steps.content: Select Appstore . You can find this underneath Silk Browser .

steps.title: Select Automatic Updates.
steps.content: Select Automatic Updates . If it was switched off, it will be turned on.
